project_descr: Productive Uses of Renewable Energy in Guatemala (PURE)

outputs.output_descr: This project aims at removing barriers to the adoption of renewable energy technologies (RETs), mainly mini/micro hydropower (MHP), by promoting productive uses of energy in one of Guatemala’s poorest areas: the departments of Alta Verapaz, Baja Verapaz, Quiché, Huehuetenango, and San Marcos. The project will create new local jobs and sources of income, while directly mitigating over 1.75 million tons and indirectly mitigating 5.25 million tons of CO2-equivalent over 20 years.  This will be achieved through the promotion of RETs that are linked to income generation and productivity enhancement

project_title: productive uses of renewable energy in guatemala
